meanings.definition: Capable of or tending to change or alter
meanings.sent1: The mutative weather turned sunny after a rainy morning.
meanings.sent2: The mutative nature of technology constantly brings new advancements.
meanings.sent3: The mutative colors of the chameleon made it hard to spot in the forest.
meanings.sent4: Her mutative ideas transformed the company's approach to marketing.
meanings.sent5: The mutative landscape shifted dramatically with the changing seasons.

meanings.sent1: The mutative substance triggered unexpected changes in the cells.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the mutative effects of radiation on organisms.
meanings.sent3: The mutative potion in the story turned the hero into a giant.
meanings.sent4: The mutative power of the chemical altered the genetic structure.
meanings.sent5: The mutative experiment resulted in a new species of plant.

meanings.definition: Undergoing or capable of undergoing mutation
meanings.sent1: The mutative gene showed variations in different environments.
meanings.sent2: The virus was mutative, making it difficult to develop a vaccine.
meanings.sent3: The mutative cells in the lab multiplied rapidly under certain conditions.
meanings.sent4: The mutative organism adapted quickly to changes in its habitat.
meanings.sent5: The mutative trait passed down through generations in the family.
